verses.verse: Man <S%H120><s%> that is born <S%H3205><s%> <S%H8803><s%> of a woman <S%H802><s%> is of few <S%H7116><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>, and full <S%H7649><s%> of trouble <S%H7267><s%>.

He cometh forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8804><s%> like a flower <S%H6731><s%>, and is cut down <S%H5243><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: he fleeth <S%H1272><s%> <S%H8799><s%> also as a shadow <S%H6738><s%>, and continueth <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not.
And dost thou open <S%H6491><s%> <S%H8804><s%> thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> upon such an one <S%H2088><s%>, and bringest <S%H935><s%> <S%H8686><s%> me into judgment <S%H4941><s%> with thee?
Who can bring <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> a clean <S%H2889><s%> thing out of an unclean <S%H2931><s%>? not one <S%H259><s%>.

Seeing <S%H518><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%> are determined <S%H2782><s%> <S%H8803><s%>, the number <S%H4557><s%> of his months <S%H2320><s%> are with thee, thou hast appointed <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%> his bounds <S%H2706><s%> that he cannot pass <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8799><s%>;
Turn <S%H8159><s%> <S%H8798><s%> from him, that he may rest <S%H2308><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, till he shall accomplish <S%H7521><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, as an hireling <S%H7916><s%>, his day <S%H3117><s%>.

For there is <S%H3426><s%> hope <S%H8615><s%> of a tree <S%H6086><s%>, if it be cut down <S%H3772><s%> <S%H8735><s%>, that it will sprout again <S%H2498><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, and that the tender branch <S%H3127><s%> thereof will not cease <S%H2308><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.
Though the root <S%H8328><s%> thereof wax old <S%H2204><s%> <S%H8686><s%> in the earth <S%H776><s%>, and the stock <S%H1503><s%> thereof die <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in the ground <S%H6083><s%>;
Yet through the scent <S%H7381><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> it will bud <S%H6524><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, and bring forth <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8804><s%> boughs <S%H7105><s%> like a plant <S%H5194><s%>.
But man <S%H1397><s%> dieth <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and wasteth away <S%H2522><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: yea, man <S%H120><s%> giveth up the ghost <S%H1478><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and where is he?
As the waters <S%H4325><s%> fail <S%H235><s%> <S%H8804><s%> from the sea <S%H3220><s%>, and the flood <S%H5104><s%> decayeth <S%H2717><s%> <S%H8799><s%> and drieth up <S%H3001><s%> <S%H8804><s%>:

So man <S%H376><s%> lieth down <S%H7901><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, and riseht <S%H6965><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not: till the heavens <S%H8064><s%> be no more <S%H1115><s%>, they shall not awake <S%H6974><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, nor be raised out <S%H5782><s%> <S%H8735><s%> of their sleep <S%H8142><s%>.

O that <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thou wouldest hide <S%H6845><s%> <S%H8686><s%> me in the grave <S%H7585><s%>, that thou wouldest keep me secret <S%H5641><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, until thy wrath <S%H639><s%> be past <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, that thou wouldest appoint <S%H7896><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me a set time <S%H2706><s%>, and remember <S%H2142><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me!

If a man <S%H1397><s%> die <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, shall he live <S%H2421><s%> <S%H8799><s%> again? all the days <S%H3117><s%> of my appointed time <S%H6635><s%> will I wait <S%H3176><s%> <S%H8762><s%>, till my change <S%H2487><s%> come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8800><s%>.

Thou shalt call <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and I will answer <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thee: thou wilt have a desire <S%H3700><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to the work <S%H4639><s%> of thine hands <S%H3027><s%>.
For now thou numberest <S%H5608><s%> <S%H8799><s%> my steps <S%H6806><s%>: dost thou not watch <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8799><s%> over my sin <S%H2403><s%> ?
My transgression <S%H6588><s%> is sealed up <S%H2856><s%> <S%H8803><s%> in a bag <S%H6872><s%>, and thou sewest up <S%H2950><s%> <S%H8799><s%> mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%>.

And surely <S%H199><s%> the mountain <S%H2022><s%> falling <S%H5307><s%> <S%H8802><s%> cometh to nought <S%H5034><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and the rock <S%H6697><s%> is removed <S%H6275><s%> <S%H8799><s%> out of his place <S%H4725><s%>.

The waters <S%H4325><s%> wear <S%H7833><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the stones <S%H68><s%>: thou washest away <S%H7857><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the things which grow <S%H5599><s%> out of the dust <S%H6083><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>; and thou destroyest <S%H6><s%> <S%H8689><s%> the hope <S%H8615><s%> of man <S%H582><s%>.

Thou prevailest <S%H8630><s%> <S%H8799><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%> against him, and he passeht <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: thou changest <S%H8138><s%> <S%H8764><s%> his countenance <S%H6440><s%>, and sendest him away <S%H7971><s%> <S%H8762><s%>.

His sons <S%H1121><s%> come to honour <S%H3513><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> it not; and they are brought low <S%H6819><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, but he perceiveth <S%H995><s%> <S%H8799><s%> it not of them.
But his flesh <S%H1320><s%> upon him shall have pain <S%H3510><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and his soul <S%H5315><s%> within him shall mourn <S%H56><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.
